record.dc:title: 32Mg66 Penn Site, Morgan County, Alabama. Features #19 and #35. Feature #19, a possible midden pit, is to the right and is located at 65L3 and is 1.80' below surface. Dimentions are 9.0' x 1.80' and 1.70'. A sherd and worked stone came from this pit. Feature #35 is one the left and is located 60L2 at 1.70' below surface. Green stone spade (F.S. #47) was in this possible burial pit.
record.dc:creator: Wayne W. Kraxberger
record.wpa:narrative: Features#19 and #35. Feature #19, a possible midden pit, is to the right and is located at 65L3 and is 1.80' below surface. Dimentions are 9.0' x 1.80' and 1.70'. A sherd and worked stone came from this pit. Also associated are F.S. #37 (3 sherds and 1 projectile point from pit fill) and F.S. #57 (1 projectile point and 1 sherd) The pit is filled with a light blue clay mixed with a iron stained clay. Feature #35 is one the left and is located 60L2 at 1.70' below surface. Green stone spade (F.S. #47) was in this possible burial pit. Associated with this pit were four pieces of worked stone (F.S. #64). No trace of bone was found.
record.wpa:comments: Shutter defective on camera. See photo 33Mg66 (uam01554).
